item.title: Dangerous horses on footpath, 23rd December
item.description:
In the field opposite my house, thereâ€™s 2 dangerous horses that have now made me scared to walk through. In the most recent event I was screaming for help as the white horse was going up on its back legs and spinning around ready to buck my dog and I. A few times the horse did kick out towards us and we had to run as fast as we could out of the gate. The horses ran fast behind us. I was left shaking and out of breath. The horses have been in the field and intimidating us since we moved in at the end of October. I am very much used to the countryside and my family own horses. I tried to remain as calm as I could (as I know animals pick up on senses), until I really really had to run myself and my dog out of the danger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alderton Road, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic light for vehicles turning right stays on red even with cars already in the filter lane, 23rd December
item.description:
At Sixways - the junction between London Road, Copt Elm Road, Ryworth Road and Greenway Lane. The light is overgrown with foliage which may be interferring with a sensor. Cars have been starting off when the left-hand lane gets the green light - maybe out of annoyance or confusion - and thus encounter traffic coming in the other direction (from the town centre). This is creating some hazardous situations. The light has been like this for several months, has been reported before and should have been fixed already.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Greenway Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole where drain is, 23rd December
item.description:
Just before you come round the bend going east on a436. This must have been patched before but all repairs seem to fall away/sink below road level. You have to drive slightly over the middle white line to avoid catching the edge which looks sharp. Ok in day time when you can see it and no traffic coming other way, but not so easy when its busy and people won't see this at night. Needs fixing urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
